title: Police identify victims from 3 separate Flint killings
content:
FLINT, MI - Flint police have identified three victims of recent homicides.
Shaun William LaBelle, 16, was found shot to death around 11 p.m. on Dec. 11 when police responded to the 4500 block of Ogema Avenue, according to Flint police.
Police offered a possible suspect vehicle description of a white, four-door car with side tinted windows and a gray stripe running down the middle of the doors with four occupants inside.
Robert David Campbell, 37, died at the scene after police responded to a shooting at 5:45 p.m. on Dec. 6 on the 600 block of Crawford Street, according to Flint police.
A neighbor in the area said they heard what sounded like gunshots and a car leaving the area quickly and noticed the man down in the street.
Charles Tyler, 56, was killed following an altercation at a home in the 3600 block of Lippincott Boulevard, Flint police said.
When officers arrived, they found an injured Tyler lying in front of the home. He was transported to the hospital, where he later died from his injuries.
Police said Tyler's death was considered a justified homicide. No further information has been released on the killing.
